If you have the qualities and drive to lead yourself or teams, there are roles ready to cultivate your skills and take you to the next level.Job Description:Job Summary:The Building & System Engineering (BaSE) Supervisor protects UPS assets including buildings, equipment, and grounds. He/She supervises facility maintenance, housekeeping, environmental and labor compliance, safety, and conveyor system reliability. He/She is responsible for ensuring environmental and safety compliance at the district level for all assigned facilities (e.g., reviews applicable facility regulations, conducts audits, performs trend analysis for compliance activities, confirming completion of Corrective Action Plans (CAPs) etc.). The BaSE Supervisor designs/ reviews safe and efficient facility and conveyor layouts to meet organizational needs for expansions, retrofits, and new buildings. This position develops, tests, and deploys software and hardware solutions. The BaSE Supervisor maintains the documentation of UPS building standards and specifications, assists the field with issues related to building standards and specifications, updates construction project documentation, and provides drafting and web support services. This position manages construction projects of low to moderate complexity and risk (i.e., conveyor installations and facility modifications), ensures adherence to contract documentation, scheduled timelines, and cost control parameters.
Responsibilities:Manages project lifecycles, including project scope, resources, schedule, initiation, start-up/design, building, and deployment to see projects from beginning-to-end.
Develops project plans (i.e., detailed plan, milestones, and work breakdown structures) and assigns tasks to resources to ensure that the project will be completed on time and according to specifications.
Follows up with assigned resources formally (e.g., status meetings, etc.) and informally to continuously manage the productivity of the team, project timelines, and deliverables.
Balances multiple projects and deployment schedules to meet stakeholder goals and expectations.
Reviews designs to ensure Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), local, and UPS conveyor guidelines and specifications are met.
Supervises the protection of physical assets, facility and equipment maintenance, and facility housekeeping to ensure a clean, efficient, and safe facility.
Schedules and reviews building automation systems reports (e.g., heating, ventilation, air conditioning, electrical, fire alarm, etc.) to maintain effective operations.
Conducts yearly facility asset protection assessments to develop work scope for next year's projects.
Performs daily preventative maintenance of electrical, mechanical, fire, water, and security systems to repair, upgrade, or replace parts required to maintain system performance.
Ensures that facility appearance is maintained at an acceptable level for the most reasonable cost using BaSE Porters and/or outside service housekeeping or IFM (Integrated Facility Management) vendors.
Performs inspections following the Environmental Facility Audit (EFA) to facilitate the comprehensiveness, accuracy, and timeliness of the audit process.
Identifies issues with current processes and recommends and implements solutions that address those issues to increase productivity at the facility.
Maintains specifications and drawings library to provide information for region and district Project Engineers and Architects.
Updates construction documents (e.g., building blueprints, PE technical manuals, etc.) to document changes to UPS and manufacturing standards.
Estimates costs using UPS guidelines and industry standards so projects can be evaluated against the district budget and approvals obtained.
Depending on the project complexity, assists with or develops alternatives, schedule, drawings, vendor list, and feasibility study and sends to REFCO committee for approval.
Audits and validates the construction project design to ensure proper installation, maintain proposed scheduling, and maintain performance specifications.
Works cross-functionally to identify and implement alternative processes that improve efficiency.
Manages vendor projects to ensure the given solution(s) aligns with the needs of UPS.
Needs to support for UPS SCS sites and GBS sites as per the requirement.Qualifications:
Bachelor's Degree or International equivalent in Engineering, Mechanical or Electrical, or related area - PreferredFacility Management – Soft services and technical, MEP (Mechanical, Electrical & Plumbing) etc.
Project Management skills
Experienced in managing Business Plan, Facilities Capex and Opex as per the organization guidelines.
Vendor/Supplier Management
Experience developing/ reading facility layouts in AutoCAD (2D) - Preferred.
Effective communication skills and detail orientation
Flexible for working in day and night shifts and willing to travel for work.
